Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CXCL11 (IFN-inducible T cell-alpha chemoattractant, I-TAC, ITAC, cytokine, CXC family;  kinocidins; UCSS1a; 2S=S, natural AMPs; human,  primates, mammals, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 6.5 ug/ml) and L. monocytogenes (MIC 8.0 ug/ml).  Antimicrobial activity was also established by (Yang et al., 2003). At 10 ug/ml, it killed 72% E. coli and 69% S. aureus.Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. Updated 2/2014; ref. 7/2014; 7/2017; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Cole AM, Ganz T, Liese AM, Burdick MD, Liu L, Strieter RM.2001
Literature Information.Title: Cutting edge: IFN-inducible ELR- CXC chemokines display defensin-like antimicrobial activity.
